summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant conducted on August 21, 2019, regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The lieutenant describes his duties, the events of August 9-10, 2019, and his limited interactions with Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The high-profile inmate at MCC who died on August 10, 2019. The interview details his intake, placement, and the circumstances leading to his death.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The supervisor of the interviewed BOP Lieutenant at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The Special Housing Unit (SHU) lieutenant at MCC who would have been responsible for enforcing the roommate rule for Epstein.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: Called the interviewee on the morning of August 10, 2019, to inform him that Epstein had attempted suicide.

persons.name: Officer THOMAS
persons.context: A corrections officer known to the interviewee for a few years, who was on scene at the hospital after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Officer NOEL
persons.context: A newer corrections officer known to the interviewee, who was on scene at the hospital after Epstein's death.

connections.description: Lieutenant was the SHU lieutenant responsible for inmates like Epstein in the Special Housing Unit, including enforcing the roommate rule.
I., as the activities lieutenant, made rounds on the evening of August 9, 2019, which would have included checking on Epstein's unit.
Both were corrections officers on scene at the hospital after Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein's Last Night in Custody
events.description: The interviewed lieutenant worked the 2PM to 10PM shift. Epstein was in the SHU without a roommate, a violation of protocol, which the lieutenant was unaware of at the time.

events.title: Epstein's Death Discovered
events.description: At approximately 6:30-6:45 AM, Lt. called the interviewee to inform him Epstein had attempted suicide. The interviewee went to the hospital where escorting staff informed him Epstein had died.

events.title: Past MCC Suicide
events.description: The lieutenant recalled a suicide taking place at MCC in 2003.

locations: United States Attorney's Office, 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
Hospital (unspecified location where Epstein's body was taken)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein did not have a cellmate in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on the night of August 9, 2019, which was a violation of the protocol requiring him to have a roommate.
The interviewed lieutenant was unaware Epstein was without a roommate that night, stating he would have enforced the rule if he had known because Epstein was on a 'hot list'.
Epstein was often in visits with his legal counsel until 7-8 PM during his incarceration.
The lieutenant advised his officers and hospital security not to speak to anyone about Epstein's death and to direct questions to the prison public relations officer.
The lieutenant assisted the FBI death investigation by collecting log books and escorting FBI agents.
